com.att.aro.bp
Interface BestPracticeDisplay

public interface BestPracticeDisplay

Defines the interface for a best practice. Developers may create new ARO best practices by creating classes that implement this interface.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAboutText()
          Returns the detailed about description of the best practice displayed in the detail panel for the best practice group.
 java.lang.String getDetailTitle()
          Returns the title of the best practice displayed in the detail panel for the best practice group.
 java.util.List<BestPracticeExport> getExportData(TraceData.Analysis analysisData)
          Allows the developer to include extra information when a best practice is exported to a file.
 java.net.URI getLearnMoreURI()
          Allows a best practice to indicate a link for more detailed information about the best practice.
 java.lang.String getOverviewTitle()
          Returns the title of the best practice displayed in the tests conducted list on the Best Practices page.
 boolean isPass(TraceData.Analysis analysis)
          Returns a value that indicates whether the specified best practices test has passed.
 boolean isSelfTest()
          Indicates whether this best practice is a manual test.
 void performAction(javax.swing.event.HyperlinkEvent h, ApplicationResourceOptimizer parent)
          This method is used to allow the best practice to do something within the application to maybe display more detail about a failed test.
 java.lang.String resultText(TraceData.Analysis analysisData)
          Returns a string containing the results of the best practices test based on the specified analysis data.
 

Method Detail

getOverviewTitle

java.lang.String getOverviewTitle()
Returns the title of the best practice displayed in the tests conducted list on the Best Practices page.

Returns:
the title string

getDetailTitle

java.lang.String getDetailTitle()
Returns the title of the best practice displayed in the detail panel for the best practice group.

Returns:
the title string

isSelfTest

boolean isSelfTest()
Indicates whether this best practice is a manual test.

Returns:
true if best practice is a self test

getAboutText

java.lang.String getAboutText()
Returns the detailed about description of the best practice displayed in the detail panel for the best practice group.

Returns:
the text string

getLearnMoreURI

java.net.URI getLearnMoreURI()
Allows a best practice to indicate a link for more detailed information about the best practice. If not null, this URI will be displayed as a "Learn More" link in the detail panel.

Returns:
The "Learn More" URI or null if one does not exist.

isPass

boolean isPass(TraceData.Analysis analysis)
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified best practices test has passed. This method is not run for a self-test.

Parameters:
analysis - The current analysis against which the best practice test is run.
Returns:
A boolean value that is "true" if the best practices test has passed, and "false" otherwise.

resultText

java.lang.String resultText(TraceData.Analysis analysisData)
Returns a string containing the results of the best practices test based on the specified analysis data.

Parameters:
analysisData - The analysis data from the trace.
Returns:
A string containing the test results.

performAction

void performAction(javax.swing.event.HyperlinkEvent h,
                   ApplicationResourceOptimizer parent)
This method is used to allow the best practice to do something within the application to maybe display more detail about a failed test. This action will be performed when the user clicks on a hyperlink in the results of a failed test. This method is never called for a self-test.

Parameters:
parent - The ARO parent window that is displaying current analysis

getExportData

java.util.List<BestPracticeExport> getExportData(TraceData.Analysis analysisData)
Allows the developer to include extra information when a best practice is exported to a file. The analysis export will always export the best practice title and pass/fail/manual. This method allows for extra information to be exported if desired.

Parameters:
analysisData - The analysis data from the trace
Returns:
A list of items to be included in the export or null if no extra information is necessary.
